_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.0  Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at White Wave Foods.

White Wave Foods prevents accidental releases through classroom and on the job training of refrigeration personnel and ongoing inspection and maintenance of the refrigeration system. Wherever possible refrigeration system components are located in areas that are not as likely to become damaged (i.e. tanks and pipe runs are placed away and protected from forklift and truck traffic). The facility maintains an ongoing emergency response program that prepares for safe evacuation and timely response by fire department personnel.

2.0  White Wave Foods and Anhydrous Ammonia

White Wave Foods processes and cools milk, cream and soy products for national distribution. Approximately 17000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia is contained within the refirgeration system on site at White Wave Foods. A Risk Management Plan has been developed as required and is maintained in order to reduce the possibility of an accidental release of ammonia from the system.

3.0  Accidental Release Prevention and Prevention Steps

White Wave Foods complies with all rules and regulations that pertain to the safe storage and use of anhydrous ammonia. Specific regulations include: OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) rule; OSHA Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response (HAZWOPER); OSHA Hazard Communication (HAZCOM); OSHA Employee Emergency Plans and Fire Prevention Plans; EPA Risk Management Plans (RMP).

Specific prevention steps that have been implemented to increase the safety of operation of the ammonia refrigeration system include: Two (2) emergency shut down push buttons are installed enabling remote shutdown of the ammonia refrigeration system; the ammonia system is inspected daily; ammonia detectors are installed in the coolers and engine room; all refrigeration service valves have identification tags; security fencing has been installed around the facility; security personnel are on site 24 hours, 7 da

ys per week.

4.0  Five Year Accident History

There has not been any reportable accidents, associated with the ammonia refrgeration system, as defined by 40 CFR Part 68, at White Wave Foods in the last five years.

5.0  White Wave Foods Emergency Response Program

White Wave Foods maintains an ongoing emergency response program to efficiently notify and evacuate employees, notify potential critical receptors in the community and state and local emergency response agencies. The program includes written procedures for proper first aid and emergency medical treatment to treat human exposures; procedures to review and update the plan and ensure that employees are informed of changes. The facility emergency response plan is coordinated with the local fire department as required by the Emergency Planning and Community Right to Know Act.

6.0  Planned Changes to Improve Safety at White Wave Foods

Future plans to improve ammonia refrigeration system safety at White Wave Foods consists of continuing operator training, periodic Process Safety Management Program audits, and on going management of the facility PSM program elements.
